organizations: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
lead_paragraph: More people are hurt while snowboarding than during any other outdoor activity, accounting for a quarter of emergency room visits, according to the first national study to estimate recreational injuries. Trailing snowboarding were sledding and hiking, researchers at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reported in the journal Wilderness and Environmental Medicine. The most common problems were broken bones and sprains, accounting for half of all cases. About 7 percent of emergency room visits were for concussions or other brain injuries.
